ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Basic drawing skills like shading and perspective

We learned about line, shadow, negative space, linear perspective, portraits. Mostly though, I would say this class was just a space to be creative and try new things more than any real instructive space.
Practice with drawing. charcoal, ink; experimentation with various art media; exposure to different art styles; instruction in how to make a gallery-ready drawing, concepts in sketching
I learned about various techniques and styles in art.
I learnt the basics of drawing!
Basic drawing techniques --  lines, contour, graphite, observation, portrait, ink, sketch, speed-drawing etc

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I thought that the class was a very beautiful space -- everyone left every class feeling good about themselves and encouraged to be creative in any way they wanted. Only complaint is that the course was a little disorganized at times -- the instructions were never super clear and often it seemed like what was written on canvas was different than what was said in class and the deadlines for projects were unclear.

I loved taking this course. It was so nontraditional and we were able to really express our creativity and explore drawing. Students were kind and we had a lot of fun together. Even though it was 2 hours, it flew by on Zoom unlike all my other classes. Such a positive experience!
I really liked the course because I was able to learn a lot about various media to draw. I found the critiques to be helpful and the professor was very knowledgable.
I loved this class! It provided me with the opportunity to be creative and use a completely different skillset than I am used to.

I really enjoyed this course throughout the semester. Regular assignment with different topic/technique/approach every week. The class increased my motivation to continue working and I had a lot of fun. The professor's comment was alway practical and encouraging. This was one my favorite class.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Virtual teaching was very effective; the course was good at adapting to online education. I felt like this was an even more convenient format than in person, as we were able to draw in the comfort of our homes. We were able to get all the required materials and still complete the assignments that we were doing in person.
My wifi connection was sometimes unstable and it was stressful, but because of zoom setting, we were able to show our work clearly sharing screen and I thought it was great.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yup! I think intro drawing is just a super fun class. You get out as much as you put in and you get to spend your homework time drawing. If you like doing art during the day it is totally worth getting into one of these sections. Note, though, that drawing and art takes a lot of time and that despite this being my "easiest" class this semester, it definitely took up the most of my time.

ABSOLUTELY! Sophy is one of the kindest, coolest people I met this semester. I had a wonderful, positive, and creative experience in this class that was hands-on and a welcome experience during this trying time.
Yes! Professor Naess and Leyla were amazing.
Yes, I definitely had a lot of fun drawing in class and I really enjoyed the various drawing prompts that we had.
I would definitely recommend this class to another student!

Yes, I definitely recommend this class to other students. I was not really expecting to learn practical art techniques through remote class in the beginning of the semester, but I leaned so much from this class. The professor is very nice and flexible. I really appreciated her help throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: None
N/A
We had a virtual lecture, demonstration, presentation, discussion, and individual work.
